description: Connection of lanes subject to a specific signal head
name: SG1

Locations.description: The given geometry composed out of ingress lane, egress lane and the real route represents the location of the lane connection.
Locations.name: SG1

Datastreams.description: A unique ID (name) of the current signal program of the traffic light. It is not the control program
Datastreams.name: Signal program ID at SG1

properties.ownerData: Free and Hanseatic City of Hamburg

ObservedProperty.description: A signal is information broadcasted e.g. visually or acoustically. The possible transmitted information is reported in the API entity 'datastream' using the 'unitOfMeasurment'-field
ObservedProperty.name: Signal

Datastreams.description: Current second in the traffic signal cycle
Datastreams.name: Cycle second at SG1

properties.ownerData: Free and Hanseatic City of Hamburg

ObservedProperty.description: A signal is information broadcasted e.g. visually or acoustically. The possible transmitted information is reported in the API entity 'datastream' using the 'unitOfMeasurment'-field
ObservedProperty.name: Signal

Datastreams.description: Datastream to broadcast the lane connection's detector status value
Datastreams.name: Signal change request - cyclists at SG1

properties.ownerData: Free and Hanseatic City of Hamburg

Sensor.description: A detector actively sensing or passively beeing activated to transmit a signal change request of a traffic participant (pedestrian, cyclist, motorized vehicle).
Sensor.metadata: Detectors serve to gain information on traffic. Various types of detectors are used for the different groups of road users. Amongst others these can be  inductive loops and infrared detectors for motor vehicles and bicycles or  touch sensors for requests by pedestrians and cyclists.
Sensor.name: Traffic participant detector

Datastreams.description: Datastream to broadcast the lane connection's signal value of a signal group
Datastreams.name: Primary signal heads at SG1

properties.ownerData: Free and Hanseatic City of Hamburg

Sensor.description: A signal head emits information. The data specific implementation/type of signal heads is described in the 'datastream'
Sensor.metadata: Signal heads belong to the basic components of a traffic signal system. Depending on the road users and the applications to which the signals are assigned different signal heads exist. Optical signal heads generally apply to motor vehicle signals, pedestrian signals, cycle signals, tram and bus signals, auxiliary signals (amber flashing light), speed signals
Sensor.name: Signal heads of traffic lights

ObservedProperty.description: A signal is information broadcasted e.g. visually or acoustically. The possible transmitted information is reported in the API entity 'datastream' using the 'unitOfMeasurment'-field
ObservedProperty.name: Signal
